comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This is a bit confusing: a later "Bristol Arms Hotel" built in 1898 is at 81 SUSSEX Street, on the west side, so it could not have had its "Back Entrance" (see note) in Kent Street. See www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2533276498/

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: We have updated the caption to state 'back entrance'. Thanks for pointing this out - we use the captions from our original listings and accept that sometimes there are errors.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] This is Day Street, looking north towards Erskine Street (see link in note). As beachcomberaustralia noted, the back entrance to the Bristol Arms Hotel on Sussex Street could not have been on Kent, as the hotel is on the west side of Sussex Street, and Kent is to the east. The back entrance to the Bristol Arms Hotel later looked like this:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5124741842/]

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: View of Day Street looking north from King Street showing wharf no. 22 (Australasian United Steam Navigation Co. Ltd.) on Darling Harbour and tram lines terminating at Erskine Street: Newly constructed Day St from Erskine to King St: Darling Harbour (no date) [SLNSW: d1_47252]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet]  Thanks for sorting this out - now clear as the light of Day Street !

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: 1895 interactive Map showing that Day Street had not yet been extended to King Street, nor the tramway. Darling Harbour Resumption Map Plan J - gallery.records.nsw.gov.au/wp-content/gallery/darling-har... Early April 1900. See comments here - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5524398488/]

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Brilliant! How did we miss the tell-tale signs of McRedie's cleanup before?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] 6 months ago we knew relatively little. In a year these comments will seem inane! Shelley Street seems to be roughly where this part of Day Street was Google Street View NB "BRISTOL ARMS TAVERN" at top right of frame.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for reminding us to change this to Day Street.
